column3: Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/5d32d3f8cd14f259cea92dfb5df07ead33b4bfb7 for binaries and test log.\n
ACK— I'm glad the timestamps allowed setting one right at 210000. It shouldn't be merged until it is burred a little more.\n
I don't see any harm in merging to HEAD (not 0.7.2) now, as 0.8 is still a long way off.\n
Oh is this just for 0.8? Yea— I don't mind merging something early for a release thats a ways off.\n

I created a 0.7.2 branch, with:

0.7.2rc2
a commit so gitian-descriptors point to github instead of gitorious
this commit, to checkpoint @ 210,000

I'm in the middle of sanity testing it by doing a complete blockchain re-download. If it is sane, and when y'all are comfortable the checkpoint is buried deep enough (I think we said "past one difficulty adjustment", which was 14 blocks ago at 21
"One difficulty adjustment" being 2016 blocks, e.g. 212016, which should be in a couple days.\n
